subject: RE: [junit] Errors.
msgSnippet: My guess would be that a property file needed by J2EEUnit is not in the classpath. -- Erik Meade             emeade@objectmentor.com Senior Consultant
messageBody:
My guess would be that a property file needed by J2EEUnit is not in
the classpath.

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> -----Original Message-----
> From: selena su [mailto:selena.su@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, March 13, 2001 12:20 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Errors.
>
>
> Hi There:
> Is there anyone has came across this error before ? When i tried to
> run the TestSampleServlet.class which will test the SampleServlet ! (i'm
> using J2EEUnit)
>
> Thanks,
> selena
>
> ===================================================================
> java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError:
> java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find bundle for base name
> j2eeunit, locale en_AU
>
> at
> java.util.ResourceBundle.throwMissingResourceException(ResourceBun
> dle.java:707)
>
> at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundleImpl(ResourceBundle.java:679)
>
> at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:546)
>
> at
> j2eeunit.client.AbstractHttpClient.<clinit>(AbstractHttpClient.java:39)
>
> at j2eeunit.ServletTestCase.runTest(ServletTestCase.java:270)
>
> at j2eeunit.ServletTestCase.runBare(ServletTestCase.java:260)
